intro: Dactylorhiza majalis subsp. ruthei, commonly known as the Ruthe’s orchid, is a terrestrial orchid belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and linear, dark green leaves. The plant produces a single, showy flower with a pale yellow lip and a greenish-yellow dorsal sepal. It is typically found in moist, acidic habitats such as bogs and heaths. This subspecies is known for its delicate appearance and is often associated with specific ecological conditions.
